main event: A brilliant white object with a bluish tint was observed dropping vertically below the horizon from an altitude of 10 degrees.
interesting points: The object appeared to drop vertically at a very slow rate of speed, much slower than a shooting star.
The sighting was made by a USAF senior master sergeant while in a taxicab, but the driver and another witness in the cab did not see the object.
The sighting lasted for approximately 6 seconds.
The weather conditions at the time were clear with high scattered clouds.
An active effort was underway at Misawa Air Base to locate other possible witnesses.
result: possible daytime meteor, no further study being conducted
sighted object: brilliant white object with bluish tint
witnesses: USAF senior master sergeant, plus two others in the taxicab
